p: Data from Table 2, showed that sub-chronic exposure of male mice to malathion-induced a significant decrease ( P < 0.05) of testis/epididymis relative-weights. Indeed, these last were reduced from 0.52 ± 0.01 to 0.63 ± 0.06 and from 0.09 ± 0.01 to 0.12 ± 0.02 in malathion-treated-group respectively. However, LSEO pre-treatment significantly ( P < 0.05) protected against malathion-caused reproductive organs weight loss.
